page.title: 03HORTICULTURE
page.content: {BROOMHOUSE NURSERY} is owned by Glasgow District Council. It supplies plants and flowers to the city. Plants from Broomhouse are used in National Competitions. This year our exhibit "A Dear Green Place" won a silver gilt at Chelsea Flower Show. Last year they swept the prizes at Liverpool Show. They hope to host a national show from the new Exhibition Centre at Finnieston in 1987. {DALDOWIE GARDEN CENTRE} is run by Strathclyde Region. Opened in 1973, it supplies trees, shrubs and plants to the region. 70 employees maintain gardens and playing fields of the region. Mr Reid, the manager, sees as his aim the provision of plants and flowers to less advantaged areas of the region.
